intro: Sarcostigma surigaoense, commonly known as the Surigao sarcostigma, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
